concept.display: Direct contact with a dead body (including during funeral rites) in a country with widespread Ebola transmission without appropriate PPE
Direct skin contact with or exposure to blood or body fluids of an Ebola patient
Healthcare personnel in facilities with confirmed or probable Ebola patients who have been in the care area for a prolonged period of time while not wearing appropriate PPE
Household members of an Ebola patient and others who had brief direct contact (eg shaking hands) with an Ebola patient without appropriate PPE
Percutaneous (eg needle stick) or mucous membrane contact with blood or body fluids from an Ebola patient
Processing blood or body fluids from an Ebola patient without appropriate PPE or biosafety precautions
Residence in or travel to a country with widespread Ebola transmission without HIGH- or LOW-risk exposure
